verses.verse: ((1 Jacob blesseth all his sons by name.10 He telleth them that Christ shall come out of Judah.29 He will be buried with his fathers.33 He dieth.) ) Then Jacob called his sons, and said, Gather yourselves together, that I may tell you what shall come to you in the (When God shall bring you out of Egypt, and because that he speaketh of the Messiah, he nameth it the last days.) last days.
Gather yourselves together, and hear, ye sons of Jacob, and hearken unto Israel your father.

¶ Reuben mine eldest son, thou art my (Begotten in my youth.) might, and the beginning of my strength, (If thou hadst not lost thy birthright by thine offense.) the excellency of dignity, and the excellency of power:

Thou wast light as water: thou shalt not be excellent, because (Cross references: : Gen. 32:22; 1 Chron. 5:1) thou wentest up to thy father’s bed: (Or, it ceased to be my bed.) then diddest thou defile my bed, thy dignity is gone.
¶ Simeon and Levi, brethren in evil, (Or, their swords were instruments of violence.) the instruments of cruelty are in their habitations.

Into their secret let not my soul come: my (Or, tongue: meaning that he neither consented to them in word nor thought.) glory be not thou joined with their assembly: for in their wrath they slew a (The Shechemites, Gen. 34:26.) man, and in their self-will they dug down a wall.

Cursed be their wrath, for it was fierce, and their rage, for it was cruel: I will (For Levi had no part, and Simeon was under Judah, Josh. 19:1, till God gave them the place of the Amalekites, 1 Chron. 4:43.) divide them in Jacob, and scatter them in Israel.
¶ Thou Judah, thy brethren shall praise thee: thy hand shall be in the neck of thine enemies: thy father’s son shall (As was verified in David and Christ.) bow down before unto thee.
Judah as a Lion’s whelp shalt thou come up from the spoil, my son. He shall lie down and couch a Lion, and as a Lioness: (His enemies shall so fear him.) Who shall stir him up?

The (Or, Kingdom.) Sceptre shall not depart from Judah, nor a Lawgiver from between his feet, until (Which is Christ the Messiah, the giver of prosperity who shall call the Gentiles to salvation.) Shiloh come, and the people shall be gathered unto him.

He shall bind his Ass foal unto the (A country most abundant with vines and pastures is promised him.) vine, and his ass’s colt unto the best vine. He shall wash his garment in wine, and his cloak in the blood of grapes.
His eyes shall be red with wine, and his teeth white with milk.
¶ Zebulun shall dwell by the seaside, and he shall be an haven for ships: and his border shall be unto Sidon.
¶ Issachar shall be a strong ass, couching down between two burdens: (Hebrew, an ass of great bones.) (His force shall be great, but he shall want courage to resist his enemies.)
And he shall see that rest is good, and that the land is pleasant, and he shall bow his shoulder to bear, and shall be subject unto tribute.
¶ Dan (Shall have the honor of a tribe.) shall judge his people as one of the tribes of Israel.
Dan shall be a (That is, full of subtlety.) serpent by the way, an adder by the path, biting the horse heels, so that his rider shall fall backward.
(Seeing the miseries that his posterity should fall into, he bursteth out in prayer to God to remedy it.) O Lord, I have waited for thy salvation.
¶ Gad, a host of men shall overcome him, but he shall overcome at the last.
¶ Concerning Asher, his (He shall abound in corn and pleasant fruits.) bread shall be fat, and he shall give pleasures for a king.
¶ Naphtali shall be a hind let go, giving (Overcoming more by fair words than by force.) goodly words.
¶ Joseph shall be (Hebrew, a son of increase.) a fruitful bough, even a fruitful bough by the well side: the (Hebrew, daughters.) small boughs shall turn upon the wall:
(As his brethren when they were his enemies, Potiphar and others.) And the archers grieved him, and shot against him, and hated him.
But his bow abode strong, and the hands of his arms were strengthened, by the hands of the mighty God of Jacob, of whom was the feeder appointed by the (That is God.) stone of Israel,

Even by the God of thy father, who shall help thee, and by the almighty, who shall bless thee with heavenly blessings from above, with blessings of the deep that lieth beneath, with blessings of the breasts, and of the womb.

The blessings of thy father shall be (Inasmuch as he was more near to the accomplishment of the promise, and it had been more often confirmed.) stronger than the blessings of mine elders: unto the end of the hills of the world they shall be on the head of Joseph, and on the top of the head of him that was (Either in dignity, or when he was sold from his brethren.) separated from his brethren.
¶ Benjamin shall raven as a wolf: in the morning he shall devour the prey, and at night he shall divide the spoil.
¶ All these are the twelve tribes of Israel, and thus their father spake unto them, and blessed them: every one of them blessed he with a several blessing.
And he charged them and said unto them, I am ready to be gathered unto my people: (Gen. 47:30) bury me with my fathers in the cave, that is in the field of Ephron the Hittite,
In the cave that is in the field of Machpelah, besides Mamre in the land of Canaan: which cave Abraham bought with the field of Ephron the Hittite for a possession to bury in.
There they buried Abraham and Sarah his wife: there they buried Isaac and Rebekah his wife: and there I buried Leah.
The purchase of the field and the cave that is therein, was bought of the children of Heth.
Thus Jacob made an end of giving charge to his sons, and (Whereby is signified how quietly he died.) plucked his feet into the bed, and gave up the ghost, and was gathered to his people.
